clinical_study.brief_title: Pain Relief Intervention of Meditation in Renal Disease (PRIMER)
clinical_study.official_title: Pain Relief Intervention of Meditation in Renal Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: Kidney Disease subjects will be recruited to take part of a mindfulness-based stress reduction intervention for 8-10 sessions. All subjects will complete a baseline interview, one follow-up at 3 months and the close out interview at 5 months.

detailed_description.textblock: Kidney Disease subjects will be recruited from multiple locations within the Rogosin Institute Dialysis Center to take part of a mindfulness-based stress reduction intervention. The intervention consists of meet with a researcher and/or research assistant on a weekly basis. Dialysis patients will receive the intervention individually while on dialysis. Dialysis is an optimal time for conducting interventions as patients are there for 3-4 hours every 3 days. For 8-10 weeks (which will begin the week after the baseline interview). Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) patients will receive the intervention in group setting. Key components of what the intervention consists relate to stress management, breathing, and meditation exercises, as well as, techniques aimed at improving relations with others, sense of mastery and purpose in life. Additionally, during every point of contact, will be asked how often they utilized the strategies they were taught. This information will be helpful in understanding each person's individual level of mastery and proficiency in Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR). All subjects will complete a baseline interview, one follow-up at 3 months and the close out interview at 5 months.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Dialysis patients will receive the intervention individually while on dialysis. Dialysis is an optimal time for conducting interventions as patients are there for 3-4 hours every 3 days. For 8-10 weeks (which will begin the week after the baseline interview). Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) patients will receive the intervention in group setting. Since CKD patients only come to see their nephrologist once a month, all CKD potential participants will be invited to attend eight consecutive weekly sessions.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of the Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction Intervention.
primary_outcome.description: This is a pilot study to test the feasibility of the Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction Intervention. In order to measure the feasibility of the MBSR, the following numbers of patients will be compared: participants referred and approached, eligible patients among those approached, eligible participants who accepted to participate, the number of sessions attended, and patients who dropped out.

secondary_outcome.description: Pain will be assessed with the Brief Pain Inventory, which analyses the influence of pain in patient's life. (Cleeland CS, Ryan KM. Pain assessment: global use of the Brief Pain Inventory. Annals of the Academy of Medicine, Singapore 1994;23:129-38.)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) and ESRD on dialysis for over 6 months and who are willing to consent. English speakers only, 18 years of age or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with severe cognitive or psychiatric impairment will be excluded. Patients who are not willing to provide consent.
